length

public com.conceptwave.scripting.Integer length
Constructor Detail

String

public String()
Method Detail

anchor

public String anchor(String name)
Use the anchor method with the document.write or document.writeln methods to programmatically create and display an anchor in a document. Create the anchor with the anchor method, and then call write or writeln to display the anchor in a document. In server-side JavaScript, use the write function to display the anchor. In the syntax, the text string represents the literal text that you want the user to see. Anchors created with the anchor method become elements in the document.anchors array.

Parameters:
nameAttribute - string represents the NAME attribute of the A tag.
Returns:
returns a copy of the string wrapped inside the appropriate HTML tag.

big

public String big()
Use the big method with the write or writeln methods to format and display a string in a document. In server-side JavaScript, use the write function to display the string.

Returns:
returns a copy of the string wrapped inside the appropriate HTML tag.

blink

public String blink()
Use the blink method with the write or writeln methods to format and display a string in a document. In server-side JavaScript, use the write function to display the string.

Returns:
returns a copy of the string wrapped inside the appropriate HTML tag.

bold

public String bold()
Use the bold method with the write or writeln methods to format and display a string in a document. In server-side JavaScript, use the write function to display the string.

Returns:
returns a copy of the string wrapped inside the appropriate HTML tag.

charAt

public String charAt(com.conceptwave.scripting.Integer position)
Returns a string containing the character at position pos in the string resulting from converting this object to a string. If there is no character at that position, the result is the empty string. The result is a string value, not a String object

Parameters:
position - An integer between 0 and 1 less than the length of the string.
Returns:
the character at the specified index of this string. The first character is at index 0.

charCodeAt

public com.conceptwave.scripting.Integer charCodeAt(com.conceptwave.scripting.Integer position)
Returns a number (a nonnegative integer less than 216) representing the code point value of the character at position pos in the string resulting from converting this object to a string. If there is no character at that position, the result is NaN.

Parameters:
position - An integer greater than 0 and less than the length of the string; if unspecified, defaults to 0.
Returns:
Returns a number indicating the Unicode value of the character at the given index.

concat

public String concat(com.conceptwave.scripting.Object String)
concat combines the text from one or more strings and returns a new string. Changes to the text in one string do not affect the other string.

Parameters:
String - Strings to concatenate to this string.
Returns:
Combines the text of two strings and returns a new string.

endsWith

public com.conceptwave.scripting.Boolean endsWith(String suffix)
Tests if this string ends with the specified suffix.

Parameters:
suffix - suffix - the suffix.
Returns:
true if the character sequence represented by the argument is a suffix of the character sequence represented by this object; false otherwise. Note that the result will be true if the argument is the empty string or is equal to this String object as determined by the equals(Object) method.

fixed

public String fixed()
Use the fixed method with the write or writeln methods to format and display a string in a document. In server-side JavaScript, use the write function to display the string.

Returns:
returns a copy of the string wrapped inside the appropriate HTML tag.

fontcolor

public String fontcolor(String color)
Use the fontcolor method with the write or writeln methods to format and display a string in a document. In server-side JavaScript, use the write function to display the string. If you express color as a hexadecimal RGB triplet, you must use the format rrggbb. For example, the hexadecimal RGB values for salmon are red=FA, green=80, and blue=72, so the RGB triplet for salmon is "FA8072". The fontcolor method overrides a value set in the fgColor property.

Parameters:
color - A string expressing the color as a hexadecimal RGB triplet or as a string literal.
Returns:
returns a copy of the string wrapped inside the appropriate HTML tag.

fontsize

public String fontsize(com.conceptwave.scripting.Object size)
Use the fontsize method with the write or writeln methods to format and display a string in a document. In server-side JavaScript, use the write function to display the string. When you specify size as an integer, you set the size of stringName to one of the 7 defined sizes. When you specify size as a string such as "-2", you adjust the font size of stringName relative to the size set in the BASEFONT tag.

Parameters:
size - An integer between 1 and 7, a string representing a signed integer between 1 and 7.
Returns:
returns a copy of the string wrapped inside the appropriate HTML tag.

fromCharCode

public static String fromCharCode(com.conceptwave.scripting.Integer unicodeCharCode)
takes the specified Unicode values and returns a string.

Parameters:
unicodeCharCode - Required. One or more Unicode values
Returns:
string

indexOf

public com.conceptwave.scripting.Integer indexOf(String substr,
                                                 com.conceptwave.scripting.Integer optionalStart)
Returns the index within the calling String object of the first occurrence of the specified value, or -1 if not found.

Parameters:
substr - A string representing the value to search for.
optionalStart - The location within the calling string to start the search from. It can be any integer between 0 and the length of the string. The default value is 0.
Returns:
Returns the index within the calling String object of the first occurrence of the specified value, or -1 if not found.

italics

public String italics()
The italics() method converts the string to an instance of the tag.

lastIndexOf

public com.conceptwave.scripting.Integer lastIndexOf(String substr,
                                                     com.conceptwave.scripting.Integer optionalStart)
Returns the index within the calling String object of the last occurrence of the specified value, or -1 if not found.

Parameters:
substr - A string representing the value to search for.
optionalStart - The location within the calling string to start the search from, indexed from left to right. It can be any integer between 0 and the length of the string. The default value is the length of the string.
Returns:
Returns the index within the calling String object of the last occurrence of the specified value, or -1 if not found.

leftPad

public String leftPad(int length,
                      String fill)
Pads the string at the left with spaces until it reaches the desired length. If the string is longer than this length, then it returns the unchanged string.

Parameters:
length - the length to reach.
fill - the string that will be padded.
Returns:
returns a copy of the string wrapped inside the appropriate HTML tag.

link

public String link(String href)
Use the link method to create an HTML snippet for a hypertext link. The returned string can then be added to the document via document.write or element.innerHTML. Links created with the link method become elements in the links array of the document object.

Parameters:
href - Any string that specifies the HREF of the A tag; it should be a valid URL (relative or absolute).
Returns:
returns a copy of the string wrapped inside the appropriate HTML tag.

match

public String match(RegExp pattern)
If the regular expression does not include the g flag, returns the same result as regexp.exec(string). If the regular expression includes the g flag, the method returns an Array containing all matches.

Parameters:
pattern - A regular expression object. If a non-RegExp object obj is passed, it is implicitly converted to a RegExp by using new RegExp(obj).
Returns:
Used to match a regular expression against a string.

replace

public String replace(RegExp pattern,
                      String replacement)
Let string denote the result of converting the this value to a string.

Parameters:
pattern - is a regular expression
replacement -
Returns:
Used to find a match between a regular expression and a string, and to replace the matched substring with a new substring.

rightPad

public String rightPad(int length,
                       String fill)
Pads the string at the right with spaces until it reaches the desired length. If the string is longer than this length, then it returns the unchanged string.

Parameters:
length - the length to reach.
fill - the string that will be padded.
Returns:
returns a copy of the string wrapped inside the appropriate HTML tag.

search

public com.conceptwave.scripting.Integer search(RegExp pattern)
Executes the search for a match between a regular expression and a specified string.

Parameters:
pattern - A regular expression object. If a non-RegExp object obj is passed, it is implicitly converted to a RegExp by using new RegExp(obj).
Returns:
If successful, search returns the index of the regular expression inside the string. Otherwise, it returns -1.

slice

public String slice(com.conceptwave.scripting.Integer from,
                    com.conceptwave.scripting.Integer optionalTo)
Extracts a section of a string and returns a new string.

Parameters:
from - The zero-based index at which to begin extraction.
optionalTo - The zero-based index at which to end extraction. If omitted, slice extracts to the end of the string.
Returns:
a substring of the result of converting this object to a string, starting from character position start and running to

Use the small method with the write or writeln methods to format and display a string in a document. In server-side JavaScript, use the write function to display the string.

Returns:

split

public Array split(String delimiter)
Splits a String object into an array of strings by separating the string into substrings.

Parameters:
delimiter - the delimiting regular expression
Returns:
the array of strings computed by splitting this string around matches of the given regular expression

startsWith

public com.conceptwave.scripting.Boolean startsWith(String prefix)
Tests if this string starts with the specified prefix.

Parameters:
prefix - the prefix.
Returns:
true if the character sequence represented by the argument is a prefix of the character sequence represented by this string; false otherwise. Note also that true will be returned if the argument is an empty string or is equal to this String object as determined by the equals(Object) method.

strike

public String strike()
Use the strike method with the write or writeln methods to format and display a string in a document. In server-side JavaScript, use the write function to display the string.

Returns:
returns a copy of the string wrapped inside the appropriate HTML tag.

String

public String String(com.conceptwave.scripting.Object p1)
Initializes a newly created String object so that it represents the same sequence of characters as the argument's toString() method; in other words, the newly created string is a copy of the argument string.

Parameters:
p1 - an Object

sub

public String sub()
Use the sub method with the write or writeln methods to format and display a string in a document. In server-side JavaScript, use the write function to generate the HTML.

Returns:
returns a copy of the string wrapped inside the appropriate HTML tag.

substr

public String substr(com.conceptwave.scripting.Integer from,
                     com.conceptwave.scripting.Integer optionalLength)
Returns a new string that is a substring of this string.

Parameters:
from - Location at which to begin extracting characters (an integer between 0 and one less than the length of the string).
optionalLength - Optional. The number of characters to extract. If omitted, it extracts the rest of the string.
Returns:
Returns a new string that is a substring of this string.

substring

public String substring(com.conceptwave.scripting.Integer from,
                        com.conceptwave.scripting.Integer optionalTo)
Returns a new string that is a substring of this string.

Parameters:
from - Required. The index where to start the extraction. First character is at index 0.
optionalTo - Optional. The index where to stop the extraction. If omitted, it extracts the rest of the string.
Returns:
Returns a new string that is a substring of this string

sup

public String sup()
Use the sup method with the write or writeln methods to format and display a string in a document. In server-side JavaScript, use the write function to generate the HTML.

Returns:
returns a copy of the string wrapped inside the appropriate HTML tag.

toLowerCase

public String toLowerCase()
The toLowerCase method returns the value of the string converted to lowercase. toLowerCase does not affect the value of the string itself.

Returns:
Returns the calling string value converted to lower case.

toUpperCase

public String toUpperCase()
The toUpperCase method returns the value of the string converted to uppercase. toUpperCase does not affect the value of the string itself.

Returns:
Returns the calling string value converted to uppercase.

trim

public String trim()
Returns:
Returns a copy of the string, with leading and trailing whitespace omitted.
